H0.text: Tessellation technically refers to which form of decoration. Geometric Pattern

H1.text: Tessellation technically refers to which form of decoration. Islamic Art

H2.text: Tessellation technically refers to which form of decoration. Stained Glass

H3.text: Tessellation technically refers to which form of decoration. Tiling/mosaic

A4.text: A tessellation or tiling is the covering of a surface, often a plane, using one or more geometric shapes, called tiles, with no overlaps and no gaps.

A5.text: The word 'tessella' means 'small square' (from tessera, square, which in turn is from the Greek word τέσσερα for four). It corresponds to the everyday term tiling, which refers to applications of tessellations, often made of glazed clay.
